hero.title: Urban Planning Authority
hero.description: The Urban Planning Authority is a government entity concerned with organizing and developing cities and regions in Libya. The authority works on preparing and approving urban plans at various levels, and coordinating development projects to ensure a balance between urbanization and the needs of the population and services. Its goal is to draw a clear vision for an organized and sustainable urban future that serves the citizen and society.
hero.newsletter_text: Sign up to our newsletter to stay informed.

slide1.title: Sustainable Urban Development
slide1.description: Analysis tools and data supporting urban planning in Libyan cities.

slide2.title: Infrastructure Insights
slide2.description: Visualizing requests and approvals to accelerate decision-making and improve transparency.

slide3.title: Transparent Urban Planning
slide3.description: Providing access to urban documents and processes in an open and clear manner.

about.title: Urban Planning Authority
about.subtitle: Responsibilities
about.role_title: Role of the Urban Planning Authority in Libya
about.description_p1: The Urban Planning Authority is a government agency established by the General People's Committee Decision No. (18) of 1993, which created this authority and defined its tasks, entrusting it with implementing Libya's policy in the field of urban planning.
about.description_p2: This authority was reorganized by the General People's Committee Decision No. (23) of 2003, which reconsidered some responsibilities and powers.
about.responsibilities: This authority has been assigned the responsibility of preparing urban plans at all levels (long-term national natural plan, regional plans and sub-regional plans, and urban plans) and supervising the complementary stages of urban plans such as approving detailed studies, approving integrated facility plans, and approving urban design work, in addition to daily follow-up of plan implementation work such as granting some permits, approving architectural projects, granting usage permits, and others.
about.role_description: The authority undertakes to contribute to drawing and implementing public policy in the field of urban planning and preparing urban development plans and programs in Libya, and coordinating between them and production and public service plans and programs to meet all required needs in accordance with the foundations set by Urban Planning Law No. "3" of 2001 and its executive regulations.

services.title: Urban Planning Services
services.subtitle: Our Services
services.description: We provide a comprehensive range of government services in the field of urban planning and building regulation

service1.title: Urban Plan Inquiries
service1.description: Inquire about approved urban plans and projects under development

service2.title: Licenses and Permits
service2.description: Issuing building licenses and permits necessary for urban projects

service3.title: Maps and Surveying
service3.description: Preparing detailed and survey maps for projects and lands

service4.title: Urban Project Evaluation
service4.description: Evaluating and reviewing urban projects to ensure compliance with standards

service5.title: Supervision and Follow-up
service5.description: Supervising project implementation and monitoring compliance with approved standards

service6.title: Legal Consultations
service6.description: Providing legal consultations related to building and planning laws

organization.name: National Authority for Urban Planning
organization.description: We work to develop and organize Libyan cities according to the latest international standards in urban planning to serve citizens and achieve sustainable development.

latest_project.title: Latest Projects
latest_project.subtitle: Short-Term Plan Project
latest_project.description: An ambitious project aimed at developing and organizing urban areas in Libya according to the latest international standards in urban planning. The project aims to improve citizens' quality of life and develop urban infrastructure.
